result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin L. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
90 days jail is ordered and stayed, to be used at the discretion of probation agent.  Jail time would be with huber for work and treatment, and would be consecutive to jail time in 16CM82.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:50 pm - Court calls cases 16CF47, 16CM81 and 16CM82.  DA states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Court orders Ct 1 on 16CM82 dismissed and amends Ct 2 to remove domestic abuse enhancer.  Court orders 16CF47 Ct 2 amended to 961.41(3g)(b), possession of controlled substance, an unclassified misdemeanor.    DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts except Ct 1 of 16CM82.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on the following, except Ct 1 in 16CF47 which court enters a deferred entry of judgment.  Comments by DE.  Court imposes:

16CF47 Ct 1 - 2 years deferred entry of judgment - see written order.  Bond to continue

Ct 2 - as amended
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

16CM81 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$65 SBDA
$801.54 restitution plus $80.15 surcharge for a total of $881.69
90 days jail with huber for work and treatment (stayed and to be used at the discretion of probation agent), cs to 16CM82
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

16CM82 - as amended
Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNAAS
$65 SBDA
30 days jail with huber for work and treatment, cs, to report by 1/1/18 at the discretion of probation agent
AODA and followthrough as appropriate
Obtain and maintain full time employment

Appeal rights given.

Cases 16CM81 and 16CM82.  Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has a warrant as he missed initial appearance last week.  Warrant vacated by court.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  One bond for both cases.

Defendant may not have contact with A.L.K, dob 8/9/99, unless written consent is filed by his mother, Juanita Osborne, with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

Cases 16CM81 and 16CM82.  Defendant Benjamin L. Krueger not in court.  Atty James R Lex appeared.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant of $500 plus execution fee.    Defendant may not have contact with Austin Krueger, unless written consent is filed by his mother with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.  One bond for both.
